00021   // check if plugin is compatible with this version
00022   // plugins may be linked static against libsass
00023   // we try to be compatible between major versions
00024   inline bool compatibility(const char* their_version)
00025   {
00026 // const char* their_version = "3.1.2";
00027     // first check if anyone has an unknown version
00028     const char* our_version = libsass_version();
00029     if (!strcmp(their_version, "[na]")) return false;
00030     if (!strcmp(our_version, "[na]")) return false;
00031 
00032     // find the position of the second dot
00033     size_t pos = string(our_version).find('.', 0);
00034     if (pos != npos) pos = string(our_version).find('.', pos + 1);
00035 
00036     // if we do not have two dots we fallback to compare complete string
00037     if (pos == npos) { return strcmp(their_version, our_version) ? 0 : 1; }
00038     // otherwise only compare up to the second dot (major versions)
00039     else { return strncmp(their_version, our_version, pos) ? 0 : 1; }
00040 
00041   }
00042 
00043   // load one specific plugin
00044   bool Plugins::load_plugin (const string& path)
00045   {
00046 
00047     typedef const char* (*__plugin_version__)(void);
00048     typedef Sass_Function_List (*__plugin_load_fns__)(void);
00049     typedef Sass_Importer_List (*__plugin_load_imps__)(void);
00050 
00051     if (LOAD_LIB(plugin, path))
00052     {
00053       // try to load initial function to query libsass version suppor
00054       if (LOAD_LIB_FN(__plugin_version__, plugin_version, "libsass_get_version"))
00055       {
00056         // get the libsass version of the plugin
00057         if (!compatibility(plugin_version())) return false;
00058         // try to get import address for "libsass_load_functions"
00059         if (LOAD_LIB_FN(__plugin_load_fns__, plugin_load_functions, "libsass_load_functions"))
00060         {
00061           Sass_Function_List fns = plugin_load_functions();
00062           while (fns && *fns) { functions.push_back(*fns); ++ fns; }
00063         }
00064         // try to get import address for "libsass_load_importers"
00065         if (LOAD_LIB_FN(__plugin_load_imps__, plugin_load_importers, "libsass_load_importers"))
00066         {
00067           Sass_Importer_List imps = plugin_load_importers();
00068           while (imps && *imps) { importers.push_back(*imps); ++ imps; }
00069         }
00070         // try to get import address for "libsass_load_headers"
00071         if (LOAD_LIB_FN(__plugin_load_imps__, plugin_load_headers, "libsass_load_headers"))
00072         {
00073           Sass_Importer_List imps = plugin_load_headers();
00074           while (imps && *imps) { headers.push_back(*imps); ++ imps; }
00075         }
00076         // success
00077         return true;
00078       }
00079       else
00080       {
00081         // print debug message to stderr (should not happen)
00082         cerr << "failed loading 'libsass_support' in <" << path << ">" << endl;
00083         if (const char* dlsym_error = dlerror()) cerr << dlsym_error << endl;
00084         CLOSE_LIB(plugin);
00085       }
00086     }
00087     else
00088     {
00089       // print debug message to stderr (should not happen)
00090       cerr << "failed loading plugin <" << path << ">" << endl;
00091       if (const char* dlopen_error = dlerror()) cerr << dlopen_error << endl;
00092     }
00093 
00094     return false;
00095 
00096   }

00098   size_t Plugins::load_plugins(const string& path)
00099   {
00100 
00101     // count plugins
00102     size_t loaded = 0;
00103 
00104     #ifdef _WIN32
00105 
00106       try
00107       {
00108 
00109         // use wchar (utf16)
00110         WIN32_FIND_DATAW data;
00111         // trailing slash is guaranteed
00112         string globsrch(path + "*.dll");
00113         // convert to wide chars (utf16) for system call
00114         wstring wglobsrch(UTF_8::convert_to_utf16(globsrch));
00115         HANDLE hFile = FindFirstFileW(wglobsrch.c_str(), &data);
00116         // check if system called returned a result
00117         // ToDo: maybe we should print a debug message
00118         if (hFile == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) return -1;
00119 
00120         // read directory
00121         while (true)
00122         {
00123           try
00124           {
00125             // the system will report the filenames with wide chars (utf16)
00126             string entry = UTF_8::convert_from_utf16(data.cFileName);
00127             // check if file ending matches exactly
00128             if (!ends_with(entry, ".dll")) continue;
00129             // load the plugin and increase counter
00130             if (load_plugin(path + entry)) ++ loaded;
00131             // check if there should be more entries
00132             if (GetLastError() == ERROR_NO_MORE_FILES) break;
00133             // load next entry (check for return type)
00134             if (!FindNextFileW(hFile, &data)) break;
00135           }
00136           catch (...)
00137           {
00138             // report the error to the console (should not happen)
00139             // seems like we got strange data from the system call?
00140             cerr << "filename in plugin path has invalid utf8?" << endl;
00141           }
00142         }
00143       }
00144       catch (utf8::invalid_utf8)
00145       {
00146         // report the error to the console (should not happen)
00147         // implementors should make sure to provide valid utf8
00148         cerr << "plugin path contains invalid utf8" << endl;
00149       }
00150 
00151     #else
00152 
00153       DIR *dp;
00154       struct dirent *dirp;
00155       if((dp  = opendir(path.c_str())) == NULL) return -1;
00156       while ((dirp = readdir(dp)) != NULL) {
00157         if (!ends_with(dirp->d_name, ".so")) continue;
00158         if (load_plugin(path + dirp->d_name)) ++ loaded;
00159       }
00160       closedir(dp);
00161 
00162     #endif
00163     return loaded;
00164 
00165   }
00166
